Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a healthy plant that has enough water and light.
The student can draw a plant that lacks water and showing signs of not being able to live or grow well.
The student can draw a plant that lacks light and showing signs of not being able to live or grow well.
The student can illustrate the difference between plants that have water and light versus those that don't by showing patterns (e.g., leaves drooping or changing color).
The student can show clear evidence in their drawing that plants need water to live and grow.
The student can show clear evidence in their drawing that plants need light to live and grow.
